pr_title: [NCL-6163] New endpoint on Artifact with direct filtering for DA

timeline.bodyText:
What I don't get is why won't we just use RSQL on getArtifacts endpoint instead of creating entire new endpoint. DA needs to prepare request anyway.
RSQL that should be equivalent example is: q=identifier=like=group:*:version;artifactQuality=in=(DELETED,BLACKLISTED,NEW...);targetRepository.repositoryType==MAVEN
If you don't want to use =in= you can group multiple ORs like this: q=identifier=like=group:*:version;(artifactQuality==NEW,artifactQuality==TEMPORARY...);targetRepository.repositoryType==NPM
RSQL will create just one query to DB.
timeline.author: michalovjan

replies.bodyText:
I have other question. Is it necessary for the endpoint to return whole Artifact? Isn't just subset of the data needed? For example, does DA need Build or TargetRepository?
I belive this endpoint should be really optimized.
replies.author: janinko

replies.bodyText:
@michalovjan  I believe that the new endpoint was suggested because of optimization as Petr describes in his doc https://docs.engineering.redhat.com/display/JP/Design%3A+Limit+usage+of+Brew+pull -> (to avoid frequent rsql parsing). @pkocandr is that right?
@janinko I am afraid I do not know what exactly DA needs from the Artifact. I can discuss this with Petr in more detail to crop the unnecessary data.
replies.author: dominikbrazdil

replies.bodyText:
@dominikbrazdil @michalovjan Yes, the concern was raised by @jbartece and it will definitely help.
@dominikbrazdil AFAIK DA currently needs only list of versions and in the future it will need also the artifact quality, so I would add it right away. The result would be just a map version -> quality.  @janinko Correct?
replies.author: pkocandr

replies.bodyText:
This endpoint should be optimized as much as possible. Using the generic endpoint with RSQL is not a good option. It will be heavily used.
I second Honza's point, if it needs to return the whole artifact. ArtifactRef should be sufficient or possibly we could even create a new DTO entity with just id, identifier and ArtifactQuality.
replies.author: jbartece

replies.bodyText: I still think that RSQL parsing is not a performance issue but with Honza's suggestion, there is need for a new endpoint anyway.
replies.author: michalovjan

replies.bodyText: It is definitely worse than without RSQL, so there is no point in parsing the string 100 000+ times a day.
replies.author: jbartece

timeline.bodyText: I think there is not need to have the results in order. DA will order the results by itself, based on the best matching version.
timeline.author: michalovjan

timeline.bodyText:
Is there a particular reason to surround the identifier with '%'?
If you'd asked for "org.jboss.pnc:pnc:jar:2.0.0.GA-redhat-00001" specifically. You could potentially get 3 artifacts (or more):

org.jboss.pnc:pnc:jar:2.0.0.GA-redhat-00001
org.jboss.pnc:pnc:jar:2.0.0.GA-redhat-00001:sources
org.jboss.pnc:pnc:jar:2.0.0.GA-redhat-00001:javadocs
timeline.author: michalovjan

replies.bodyText: Well I thought that if the endpoint input is the identifier "pattern" then it should behave as LIKE functionality all the time. But if the case is more that it will be used for specific version calls then it should be probably based only on "*" present in the pattern.
replies.author: dominikbrazdil

replies.bodyText: The queries for the identifier MUST NEVER have "%" at the begining, so we can utilize index prefix search in DB. Otherwise the DB would have to do full scan over the whole table.
replies.author: janinko

replies.bodyText: OK, so I will leave only the 'replace' part and DA will specify by "*" whenever it will need to search all identifiers that match the pattern.
replies.author: dominikbrazdil

timeline.bodyText: Do we have artifact type (MVN/NPM) easily available? I guess we know it from the context, but I think that we could have it here so we know how to parse the identifier.
